isis.stitle: PRE-DELIVERY/QUALITY INSPECTION INSTRUCTION MANUAL FOR FBC/BUS/STRIPPED CHASSIS - INSPECTION - CHASSIS INSPECTION

item.para: Refer to the operator's manual for proper lubrication procedures and capacities. Be sure to lubricate steering upper slip joint. (Refer to Figure 5.)
Install grease fittings in place of plugs to lubricate. Replace plugs when finished.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Lubrication Point On Steering Upper Slip Joint

item.para: A correctly phased propeller shaft has its yoke bores or flange ears in the same plane at each end.

The slip joint and shaft are marked with arrows or dots which must be lined up to indicate they are in phase. If they are not lined up, loosen and rotate the slip joint to align the marks. (Refer to Figure 6.)
Verify that center bearing assembly mounting bolts are tight.
Make sure the bearing insulator is not out of carrier alignment and slinger is not contacting another component.

svcprocinfo.para: 36. Muffler and exhaust pipe(s) bracket mounting plus tightness; also system positioning and routing.

item.para: Inspect complete exhaust system for leaks, tightness, routing and support integrity. Correct as required.

svcprocinfo.para: 37. Rear axle oil level. Correct as required.

item.para: Clean dirt and grease from around the filler plug and remove. ( Refer to Figure 7.)
Verify that the rear axle is filled to the bottom of the filler hole (level with the filler hole opening). Refill if necessary. Refer to the operator's manual for proper procedures.
Verify that drain plug is tight.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Proper Rear Axle Oil Level (Manual Transmission Similar)

svcprocinfo.para: 38. All spring U-bolts, re-torque to specifications.
39. Air suspension system for leaks and hose clearance from moving parts, sharp edges and heat sources; also proper routing and clipping. Relocate as needed.
40. Air suspension air spring height setting. Adjust to specifications.

svcsubproc.title: Check the Air Spring Height Setting

item.para: Air spring height on vehicles equipped with International or Neway air suspension is measured from the bottom of a straight edge placed on the top metal plates of the air springs to the top of the transverse crossmember that the air springs are mounted to (refer to Figure 8). These dimensions control ride height. If resetting the air spring to obtain the proper ride height, deflate the system and then reset the height by inflating the air spring. DO NOT SET THE HEIGHT BY LETTING AIR OUT.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Checking The Air Spring Height Setting

table.title: Air Suspension Measurements International Air Suspension

svcsubproc.title: Fixed Ride Height Vertical Linkage
svcsubproc.para: International has changed the air suspension control valve vertical linkage from an adjustable linkage to a fixed length linkage. The fixed length vertical linkage, SE Code 814UHY (see Figure 9), went into effect on February 24, 1995 and the sleeve type "fixed" vertical linkage (see Figure 10) went into effect during the 1st quarter of 1996.

step1.para: Verify that the center punch mark on the leveling valve capscrew is positioned toward the axle end of the lever arm. Center to center distance on the lever arm is 7 inches. If not, loosen the capscrew and move the lever arm to lengthen or shorten the arm to obtain 7 inches. Retighten the capscrew.
Assure that approximately 100 psi (689.5 kPa) air pressure is available in reservoir system (check cab gauge).
The height adjustment is set at the rear axle on a 4x2 chassis and the rear-rear axle on a 6x4 chassis.

step2.para: Place a straight edge on the center line of the top metal plate on the air springs (see Figure 8). Do not position the straight edge on the frame rails. Measure the distance from the bottom edge of the straight edge down to the top edge of the transverse crossmember (see Figure 8).
The air spring height is Item 2 in Figure 8.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. END OF ROD TO BE FLUSH WITH FLAT EDGE OF VALVE
6. CENTER PUNCH MARK TO BE TOWARD LINK END OF ROD

step1.para: If distance is not as specified:

step2.para: If the distance is less than specified, slightly raise valve lever arm and hold up until the distance increases to the correct specification. Move the lever arm to the valve neutral or horizontal position.

If the distance is greater than specified, lower the valve lever arm and hold down until the distance is less than specified. Slightly raise valve lever arm and hold up until the distance increases to specification. Move the lever arm to the valve neutral or horizontal position.

When the correct specified height has been attained, install two centering pins (use two No. 21, or 5/32 inch drill bits) in the valve body to maintain the lever arm in the horizontal or centered position while installing the new fixed vertical link to the lever arm and transverse crossmember.

step1.para: Install fixed vertical linkage as follows:

step2.para: Take the bottom nut off the threaded end of the fixed linkage and install the threaded end of the fixed vertical linkage in the hole in the transverse crossmember. Then install the opposite end onto the lever arm. Install the flat washer and cotter pin on the lever arm to hold the linkage in place.

Tighten the nut that rests on the top side of the transverse crossmember until it is finger tight so as not to bend the lever arm. When satisfied with positioning, tighten the nut on the bottom side of the transverse crossmember, then the jam nut on the top side of the crossmember.

svcsubproc.para: 41. Brake hose clipping and clamp tightness. Make sure hoses are clear of moving parts, sharp edges, and heat sources. Relocate as needed.

item.para: Visually inspect and relocate hoses if necessary to avoid moving objects, sharp edges, and heat sources.
The fluid level must be up to the bottom edge of the ring on each reservoir fill port. Adjust as necessary. DO NOT fill to the top of the reservoir. Refer to the operator's manual.

svcsubproc.para: 43. Fuel line(s) clearance from moving parts, sharp edges, and heat sources; also proper routing and clipping. Relocate as needed.

item.para: Visually inspect and relocate lines if necessary to avoid moving objects, sharp edges, and heat sources. Relocate as needed.

svcsubproc.para: 44. Transmission oil level. Correct as required.

item.para: Remove the filler plug and visually inspect the oil level. It must reach the bottom of the filler hole.

svcsubproc.title: Automatic Transmissions

item.para: Refer to the transmission manufacturer operator's manual for correct procedures.

svcsubproc.para: 45. Front hub(s) for leaks and proper oil level.

item.para: A clear cap on the end of the axle will show if the oil level is correct (refer to Figure 11). Refill if necessary. Refer to the oil hub manufacturer's instructions for specific procedures.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Front Hub Oil Level Indicator

svcsubproc.para: 46. Wheel/rim runout. Adjust to specfications. Retorque wheel/rim mounting nuts to specifications. Refer to the WHEEL, RIM AND TIRES Section of the Service Manual for the proper procedure to align wheels and rims. Re-torque wheel/rim mounting nuts to specifications found in the WHEELS, RIMS and TIRES section of the Service Manual. Use the proper wheel nut tightening sequence for the type of wheel. Refer to Figure 12 and Figure 13.

caution.para: Excessive tightening of the wheel nuts will elongate the bolt and deform the contact surface of the nut, resulting in an incorrect torque setting. Never use lubricants on wheel nuts or studs. Always tighten dry.

note.para: Refer to the Wheels, Rims and Tires section of the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Cast Spoke Wheel Tightening Sequence

entry.para: Flange: Motor Wheel - 37.5 mm Across Flats
Standard Square Cap: 13/16 inch Across Flats
Standard Square Cap: 1-1/2 inches Across Flats
Standard Hex Cap: 1-3/4 inches Across Flats
Heavy Duty Square Cap: 15/16 inch Across Flats
Heavy Duty Cap: 1-3/4 inches Across Flats

para.emph: Where excessive corrosion exists, a light coat of lubricant on first three threads of stud bolt is permitted.
Keep lubricant away from cap nut ball faces, or ball seats of disc wheels and rim clamps.

svcsubproc.para: 47. Tire air pressure. Fill to the proper inflation pressure.

item.para: Refer to the correct operator's manual for further information plus the tire load and inflation pressure charts.

svcsubproc.para: 48. Retorque axle flange nuts or driveshaft u-joint retaining bolts/ nuts if removed for shipping.

item.para: Make sure new gaskets have been installed on each axle removed by the transport carrier.
Tighten the nuts in a star pattern to the specified torque to ensure the axle flanges are properly seated. Refer to Table 5 below.
Inspect slip joint boot for damage.
Insure that the removed U-joint is properly seated in position.
Tighten bolts/nuts to specification. NOTE: U-joint strap retaining bolts have a thread locking patch; they may be used one time only. Refer to Table 6.

table.title: Axle Flange Nut and Bolt Torque Chart

entry.para: NOTES: The bolts can only be used once for all series.
Straps and retainers for all series can be re-used if not damaged.

svcsubproc.para: 49. Battery cable end tightness and cable routing. Lubricate terminal ends and fasteners. Relocate as needed.
50. Correct installation of battery hold-down hardware.
51. State of battery charge (recharge if 12.4V or less).
